body: Does it work if you don't press the `Shift` key? So just pressing ctrl + '+'?
What output do you get with `alacritty --print-events` when trying to trigger the binding?
Does this get fixed when you change your mappings to use `Add` instead of `Equals` in the `alacritty.yml`?
not sure if this is a bug, or something is missing in the docs

In theory this is documented in the `alacritty.yml`. It is explicitly specified that the `Equals` key is used to increase the font size.

The problem with this is just that this key doesn't seem to exist on the german keyboard layout, but only the `0` and `+` keys.

I guess for this instance a potential solution would be to add the same binding to the `Add` key by default. Since it's not available on layouts that have the `Equals` key and the `Equals` key is not available on layouts that have the `Add` key, it should work fine.

issue.title: Adds keybinding for 'de' layout keyboards #2010
issue.body:
This closes #2010  by implementing the suggestion made by @chrisduerr to include the IncreaseFontSize keybinding for the 'Add' key by default.

I tested this on MacOS and Arch Linux, and it seems to work. All of the cargo tests pass as well.

Also, I realize there's not a lot going on in this PR, but it's my first 'real' one so any suggestions or critiques about the code or the message would be most welcome! Thanks :)
